text: <@U0TKW6J68|jurgen> has joined the channel
HI, I just joined. I have a technical question, someone here to answer me?

I'm wanting to see what I can do for the hyperledger project, but I'm not a programmer. I'm having +20 years with Linux in the Enterprise. Broad and deep knowledge of infrastructures with a strong focus on Linux
Able to script a bit in Perl/Python
hi <@U0TKW6J68>, there's a F2F next week and there are the weekly calls. There are things non programmers can do and most of it is talked about on the calls.

Is there any chance of a single source of truth? I am currently trying to track down the agenda for the F2F which i am sure I saw fly by during the week but i don't know if I saw it as a link on slack or in the mailing list, and it could have been a google drive link (does hyperledger actually have a shared google drive space or are people using their personal drives?), part of the wiki or on git... hunting down things is becoming time consuming and we don't have much yet...
<@U0Q6BA1EU|bobbiejc> has joined the channel
<@U0Q7KRNSJ>: Here is the agenda as of Wednesday: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/cbf/F0TCP5G5T/hyperledger_hackathon_agenda_20160316.pptx>
<@U0NQY299A|igor.lilic> mentioned a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/cbf/F0TCP5G5T/hyperledger_hackathon_agenda_20160316.pptx|Hyperledger Hackathon Agenda 20160316.pptx>.
But I don't exactly know what the current agenda / schedule looks like for next week

<@U0KM61BCP>: Is there a more complete agenda?
Address to the location
What time do we kick off
What time do we end
etc..
confirmations will be sent to all confirmed attendees within 24 hours with the necessary details
in terms of agenda — the PPT you just attached is the best version.  it will largely run in unconference format, as opposed to detailed timeslots/sessions
Thanks <@U0J038AJK>
Unconference is fine :simple_smile: start times and address would be useful though
there are two main places to find information 1) TSC list archives <http://lists.hyperledger.org/pipermail/hyperledger-tsc/> 2) wiki <https://github.com/hyperledger/hyperledger/wiki>

attachments.title: hyperledger/hyperledger
attachments.text: Hyperledger Project is a new Collaborative Project at The Linux Foundation. The technical community is just getting started and will be adding code to the repository in the coming weeks. Check hype...

text: well get the location to all confirmed attendees via email (instead of blasting the channel)
9-5 tuesday, wednesday, thursday, 9-1pm on friday
Sounds good - ty
in brooklyn, ny
